snippet: Apple announced that it would audit conditions in supplier factories, Greek austerity measures won parliamentary approval and youth unemployment tightened its grip in Britain.
John Kinnucan, a technology analyst who gained notoriety last year for openly challenging federal authorities, was arrested on Thursday night.
abstract: John Kinnucan, a technology analyst who gained notoriety last year for openly challenging federal authorities, was arrested on Thursday night.

headline.main: Tech Analyst Arrested in Insider Trading Crackdown
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Arrests Tech Analyst In Trading Crackdown

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and BEN PROTESS

snippet: An inspector’s comments praising conditions at Chinese plants of Apple’s largest supplier are upbeat, but some call them premature and troubling.
abstract: Auret van Heerden, president of of a nonprofit group hired by Apple to inspect its suppliers' factories, begins praising the Chinese plants of Foxconn, Apple's largest supplier, just days after his group began inspections there; some call his comments premature and troubling.

headline.main: Early Praise in Inspection at Foxconn Brings Doubt
headline.print_headline: Early Praise In Inspection At Foxconn Brings Doubt

snippet: Apple released a preview of Mountain Lion, its new software for Mac computers. Certain of its features, however, move it closer to iOS, which runs Apple’s tablets and phones.
abstract: Apple releases a preview of Mountain Lion, its new software for Mac computers; some of its features move it closer to iOS, which runs Apple’s tablets and phones; with the release, the company is sending a clear message that its goal is to integrate its products.

headline.main: New Apple Operating System Aims to Knit Together Its Products
headline.print_headline: New Apple Operating System Aims to Knit Together Its Products

snippet: The Norwegian pianist Leif Ove Andsnes managed to be buttoned-up and exciting at the same time in a solo recital at Carnegie Hall on Wednesday.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini reviews concert of classical music works by pianist Leif Ove Andsnes at Carnegie Hall; performance is recorded and broadcast live on the WQXR radio station.

headline.main: Excitement in the Air, Without a Button Undone
headline.print_headline: Excitement in the Air, Without a Button Undone

snippet: A selected guide to theater performances in New York.

Chinese media reported that the authorities had seized iPads in the central city of Zhengzhou and the eastern port of Qingdao amid a trademark dispute, according to The Associated Press. The Chinese company that claims to own the trademark may see...
abstract: Chinese media reported that the authorities had seized iPads in the central city of Zhengzhou and the eastern port of Qingdao amid a trademark dispute, according to The Associated Press. The Chinese company that claims to own the trademark may seek a ban on exports of iPads from China as well.

headline.main: IPad Trademark Troubles in China Continue

snippet: The singer joins a list of performers who say that record companies have not compensated them fully for digital downloads; digital sales jump in Britain.; a streaming service in India grows with the help of Facebook.
abstract: The singer joins a list of performers who say that record companies have not compensated them fully for digital downloads; digital sales jump in Britain.; a streaming service in India grows with the help of Facebook.

headline.main: Digital Notes: Kenny Rogers Sues, Saying He Is Due $400,000 in Royalties

snippet: With Mountain Lion, the next operating system for its Mac computers, Apple has one clear message: If you're going to buy one Apple product, you might as well keep buying more. Apple's sneak peek at Mountain Lion reveals its intent to make the Mac ...
abstract: With Mountain Lion, the next operating system for its Mac computers, Apple has one clear message: If you're going to buy one Apple product, you might as well keep buying more. Apple's sneak peek at Mountain Lion reveals its intent to make the Mac interface look more and more like its mobile operating system.

headline.main: Apple Aims to Tie the Mac More Tightly to iPad and iPhone

snippet: The Proenza Schouler girl's look has "the confidence of not having to do anything," according to Paul Hanlon.
abstract: The Proenza Schouler girl's look has "the confidence of not having to do anything," according to Paul Hanlon.
